intro: Consolida paniculata, commonly known as the sweet rocket or honeyflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its tall, branching stems and clusters of fragrant, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
